info.title: Sample adapter for connecting WebTrit to a BSS
info.description:
Adapter that translates API requests from WebTrit core
        to a hosted PBX system. It enables to authenticate users,
        obtain their SIP credentials, etc.

post.description: Login user using username and password

patch.description: Refresh user's API session and retrieve new tokens

post.description:
Establish an authenticated session without any direct interaction with the user
by utilizing a temporary "provisioning token" (sent via email, SMS, QR code)

Returns:
SessionResponse (so the result is identical to the regular login)
Generate and send an OTP to the user
Verify the OTP and sign in the user

get.description: Supply information about the capabilities of the hosted PBX system and/or BSS adapter

post.description:
Create a new user on the BSS / hosted PBX side as a part of the sign-up process.
The input data depends on the specifics of your application (e.g. one would sign
up users just using their mobile phone number, while another would require address,
email, credit card info, etc.) - so it is not defined by the schema and passed "as is".

Parameters:
body - dictionary with the user's data

Returns:
    UserCreateResponse, which (upon success) can contain one of the following objects:
        - SessionResponse means that a new user was created and signed in, the object
            contains the access token to be used for subsequent requests
        - SessionOtpCreateResponse means that a new user was created and an OTP
            (email, SMS, etc.) was sent to the user, the object contains the OTP
            request ID. The user should be prompted for the OTP code and then it
            will be validated with OTP request ID.
        - freeform dictionary with the data to be interpreted by the front-end app

delete.description: Delete an existing user - this functionality is required if the app allows to sign up

get.description: Get corporate directory (contacts of other users in the same PBX)
Get contact information by user ID

post.description:
The invocation of custom methods not explicitly defined in the documentation,
expanding functionality through predefined rules.

The invocation of custom methods with access token verification not explicitly
defined in the documentation, expanding functionality through predefined rules.

AccessToken.title: AccessToken
AccessToken.description:
A short-lived token that grants access to the API resources.

It must be included as an Authorization header in the format `Bearer {access_token}` with each API request.
The `access_token` has an expiration date, so it needs to be refreshed periodically using a `refresh_token`
to maintain uninterrupted access to the API without requiring the user to manually sign in again.

Please note that the `access_token` should be kept secure and not shared, as it grants access to the user's
data and actions within the API.

balance_type.description:
Meaning of the balance figure for this user.

* `inapplicable` means the **Adaptee** does not handle
  billing and does not have the balance data.
* `prepaid` means the number reflects the funds that
  the user has available for spending.
* `postpaid` means the balance reflects the amount of
  previously accumulated charges (how much the user
  owes - to be used in conjunction with a `credit_limit`).

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency symbol or name in ISO 4217:2015 format (e.g. USD).

call_id.title: Call Id
call_id.description: The field serves as the unique identifier for each call record.

callee.title: Callee
callee.description: The phone number of the called party (recipient of the call, CLD).

caller.title: Caller
caller.description: The phone number of the calling party (originator of the call, CLI).

connect_time.title: Connect Time
connect_time.description: Datetime of the call connection in ISO format.

disconnect_reason.title: Disconnect Reason
disconnect_reason.description: Describes the reason for the call disconnection.

disconnect_time.title: Disconnect Time
disconnect_time.description: Datetime of the call disconnection in ISO format.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Call duration (in seconds), 0 for failed calls.

CallRecordingId.title: CallRecordingId
CallRecordingId.description: A unique identifier for a call recording, used to reference the recorded media of a specific call.

user_id.description: Unique identifier of the contact on the **Adaptee**. Optional for synthetic entries.

is_current_user.title: Is Current User
is_current_user.description: Indicates whether the contact is associated with the same user who making the request.

alias_name.title: Alias Name
alias_name.description: The user's alternative name. May be used for indicate role or position.

company_name.title: Company Name
company_name.description: The name of the company the user is associated with.

sip_status.description: The current registration status of the user on the SIP server.

code.title: Code
code.description:
Additional error code identifier to help better handle
                                            situations that fall within the same HTTP error code.
                                            E.g. a request to login is denied with 401 HTTP error
                                            but the code will additionally indicate the specific
                                            reason: username / password are incorrect or the user's
                                            account has been administratively blocked. This code will
                                            be passed to the client, so the app can show a proper message on UI

additional.title: Additional
additional.description:
A list of other phone numbers associated with the user. This may
include extra phone numbers that the user purchased (also called
direct-inward-dials or DID) to ring on their VoIP phone,
and other numbers that can be used to identify them in the
address book of others (e.g. their mobile number).

ext.title: Ext
ext.description: The user's extension number (short dialing code) within the **Adaptee**.

main.title: Main
main.description:
The user's primary phone number. It is strongly suggested
to use the full number, including the country code
(also known as the E.164 format).

sms.title: Sms
sms.description:
A list of phone sms phone numbers associated with the user.
These numbers may be associated with third-party SMS services, such as Twilio,
and can include mobile numbers capable of receiving text messages.

OtpId.title: OtpId
OtpId.description:
Unique identifier of the OTP request on the **Adapter** and/or **Adaptee** side.

Note: This ID is NOT the code that the user will enter. It serves
to match the originally generated OTP with the one provided by the user.

items_per_page.title: Items Per Page
items_per_page.description: Number of items presented per page.

items_total.title: Items Total
items_total.description:
Total number of items found in filtered result set.
If no filters are provided, this represents total number
of items available.

RefreshToken.title: RefreshToken
RefreshToken.description:
A single-use token for refreshing the API session and obtaining a new `access_token`.

When the current `access_token` is close to expiration or has already expired, the
`refresh_token` can be exchanged for a new `access_token`, ensuring uninterrupted access
to the API without requiring the user to manually sign in again.

Please note that each `refresh_token` can only be used once, and a new `refresh_token`
will be issued along with the new `access_token`.

config_token.title: Config Token
config_token.description: URL encoded unique token to identify user on the **Adaptee**.

SessionInfo.title: SessionInfo
SessionInfo.description: Info about a session, initiated by WebTrit core on behalf of user

delivery_channel.description:
Specifies the channel used to deliver the OTP to the user
(e.g., email, SMS, call, or other). This information helps guide the
user on where to find the OTP.

delivery_from.title: Delivery From
delivery_from.description:
Identifies the sender of the OTP, making it easier for the user to
locate the correct message. Depending on the `delivery_channel`, this
value may be an email address, phone number, or a description of an
alternative method. In the case of email, if the message is marked as
spam, the user can add this address to a whitelist for future
reference.

code.title: Code
code.description:
Code (one-time-password) that the end-user receives from
the **Adaptee** via email/SMS and then uses in
application to confirm his/her identity and login.

auth_username.title: Auth Username

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description:
The visible identification of the caller to be included in the SIP request.
This will be shown to the called party as the caller's name. If not provided,
the `display_name` will be populated with the `username`.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password for the SIP account.

transport.description: The transport protocol for SIP communication. UDP by default.

username.title: Username
username.description:
The identity (typically a phone number but can be some other alphanumeric ID)
that should be registered to SIP server to receive incoming calls.
Usually it is also used as a username for SIP authorization of registrations (SIP REGISTER)
and outgoing calls (SIP INVITE).

host.title: Host
host.description: The SIP server address, which can be either a hostname or an IP address.

port.title: Port
port.description: The port on which the SIP server listens for incoming requests. 5060 by default.

custom.title: Custom
custom.description:
Additional custom key-value pairs providing extended information about
the **Adaptee** and/or its environment.

supported.title: Supported
supported.description:
A list of supported functionalities by the **Adaptee**.

Possible functionalities values:
* `signup` - supports the creation of new customer accounts
* `otpSignin` - allows user authorization via One-Time Password (OTP)
* `passwordSignin` - allows user authorization using login and password
* `autoProvision` - allows user authorization using config token
* `recordings` - provides access to call recordings
* `callHistory` - provides access to call history
* `extensions` - retrieves the list of other users (contacts)

UserCreateRequest.title: UserCreateRequest
UserCreateRequest.description: Request model for user creation - flexible dictionary-like structure

UserId.title: UserId
UserId.description:
A primary unique identifier of the user on the **Adaptee**.

This identifier is crucial for the proper functioning of **WebTrit Core**, as it is used
to store information such as push tokens and other relevant data associated to the user.

The **Adaptee** must consistently return the same `UserId` for the same user,
regardless of the `UserRef` used for sign-in.

alias_name.title: Alias Name
alias_name.description: The user's alternative name. May be used for indicate role or position.

company_name.title: Company Name
company_name.description: The company the user is associated with.

status.description:
The user's account status.

* `active`, the user is in an active state and has full access to all functionality
  (this is the default value and will be assumed if this property is not specified)
* `limited`, indicates a condition of restricted functionality access
  (while sign-in and API calls may be allowed, call capabilities could
  be partially or fully restricted)
* `blocked`, denotes a state in which the user is blocked, and as a result,
  client applications won't be able to sign in and will be signed out if
  previously signed in
  (API calls might be partially available, but call capabilities are fully
  restricted)

Note that the number of possible values may be expanded in the future.

time_zone.title: Time Zone
time_zone.description:
The preferred time zone for the user's displayed time values
(see [time zones list](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones)).
If not provided, the **WebTrit Core** server time zone is used.

UserRef.title: UserRef
UserRef.description:
A reference identifier of the user on the **Adaptee**

This identifier is entered by the user in client applications and passed
via **WebTrit Core** to the **Adaptee** for sign-in purposes.

The identifier can be a phone number or any other attribute associated
with the user. When the same user is accessed using different references,
it is crucial to ensure that the same `UserId` is assigned to this user.

code.title: Code
code.description:
`code` field values that are defined (but can be expanded) are:
- `validation_error`

details.title: Details
details.description: Additional details related to the error code, which depend on the specific error.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique ID of the message.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The duration of the voice message in seconds.

size.title: Size
size.description: The total size of all attachments in the message in KB.

date.title: Date
date.description: The delivery date of the message.

seen.title: Seen
seen.description: Indicates whether this message has been seen.

type.title: Type
type.description: The MIME type of the body.

subtype.title: Subtype
subtype.description: The MIME subtype of the body.

size.title: Size
size.description: The size of the body in KB.

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: The name of the attached file.
